We figured that is where we had to stay because we got a good rate. Once I turned on my laptop and found out the internet wasn't working there, we went back to the desk and told them to get that fixed. At this point a lady was at the desk and she seemed much more effecient. She found us another room, that was way bigger and the internet worked. So we took it. Third issue... I think truly this is an old apartment because the sound travels everywhere. The patio door to the outside seems to be very thing and you can whisper outside at the street and you can hear it in the room. It was horrible. I don't think the door closed properly, but even so, the sound was horrible. We got woken up one morning at 1am and had to phone down to customer service to inform them that a bunch of guys where in the pool smoking pot and partying. Since the pool is just around the corner from the lobby, I don't understand why they didn't hear it. The ladies who were at the front desk where great and always helpful. The cleaning staff was good and the continental breakfast was better than I had expected (considering the hotel). I don't even think for the price (travel agent rate), I would stay there again. It was way to noisy and the fact that they gave us that horrible room in the first place, was a bad first impression. I won't be recommending it to my clients. If you are forewarned about this place, then it is ok. Everything was clean and it was so nice and close to everything. Maybe if they did some updates to the rooms and made it look a little more like a hotel and not an apartment, it would be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: runbkswm
Reviews.Content: I don't get some of the other reviews on this site. I was in town on a business trip and this place was perfect for me. I had a large room overlooking the harbor. Bed was super comfy and linens were new & clean. The staff told me that the hotel had been refurbished recently and it was clear that it had been. The free wi-fi was great for checking my email. Breakfast was nothing fancy except for the waffles (yum!!) and free too. I had dinner across the road at the Pizza joint and that was very tasty and convenient. There was some road noise but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but is otherwise lacking.”
Reviews.Author: runchadrun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a conference at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay, which was much more expensive so some colleagues and I found this hotel and figured we would just carpool to the Hyatt. First the good: the place looks nice. The reviewer who said the decor looks dated must have stayed in a different hotel because all of the decor in the rooms and public spaces was contemporary and new. It is obvious that the hotel was recently renovated. Rooms have microwaves and fridges. The location is good if you're going to the airport or harbor. There are many seafood restaurants in the area, and we ate at Pomodoro twice, which is an Italian restaurant staffed by actual Italians. Now the bad: -When I checked in the rate they tried to give me was higher than the confirmed AAA rate that I got from bestwestern.com. When I showed them my printed confirmation they fixed it. In looking at other reviews it appears I'm not the only person they tried to overcharge. -The wireless Internet didn't work for the entire weekend. I talked to the front desk a few times and called BW's Internet tech support twice. I'm an IT guy and, according to tech support, the access points needed to be restarted but the front desk said no one in the hotel knew how to do it. All they knew how to do was reset the router, which wasn't the problem. I offered to help and they said no. So the only Internet access was a sole PC near the lobby. -The hot and cold in the shower were switched and one of my friends said hers was also switched. Either the pipes are backwards or, more likely, the handle was put on upside down. One morning I took a shower at 8:00 and the hot water was almost gone. (The previous night when I washed my hands the water was almost scaling so there is hot water sometimes.) -Another friend traveling with me said she came back to her room at 10:00 pm and it hadn't been made up. -The rooms are indeed small. My king room had about 2 feet clearance on one side and 3 feet on the other, and bout 3 feet at the foot of the bed. --Each room has a balcony and a nice view but there's no furniture out there. -There is a lot of outside traffic noise at this hotel--not the hotel's fault, it's just in a noisy location. I heard no noise from the neighbors; it was all from the outside. So if you are sensitive to noise bring earplugs. Overall I was not impressed by this hotel in the least and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: kashish_shrm
Reviews.Content: nice location, excellent service...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LeahMcT
Reviews.Content: My large extended family, including my husband, 2 year old, 1 year old, my 50-something parents, my 60-something mother-in-law and my 70-something grandmother all came to San Diego for a little family holiday. We booked this hotel based on the price (as my retired grandmother and mother-in-law are on tight budgets) and it's proximity to all the attractions we wanted to see. I was amazed at just how close it was to the airport without feeling like we were on the runway as well as just how close it was to all amenities (10 minutes to Sea World, 5 minutes to the Zoo, many restaurants and a grocery store within minutes). The rooms are basic but clean, the bathrooms look like they've recently been renovated, and quite sound-proof (my parents were in the room beside us and couldn't hear the kids at all). The rooms do seem like they are a touch on the small side, we felt a little cramped with 3 suitcases in there but not to the point of being annoying. There was a mini-fridge and a microwave in the room which was fantastic for us with small children. My only minor complaints was that the "continental breakfast" was quite minimal and by our 5th day the breads/muffins/etc were stale and there was only a couple of bruised apples and under ripe oranges for fruit. The other was when we checked in there was a discrepency over the price - I had booked via the 1-800 number and was quoted an AAA rate of $89/night. However when I checked in they told me I was wrong and the rate they had was $99/night. Fortunately for me I had my printed e-mail confirmation and once I showed this to the front desk agent she immediately corrected it, but I wonder what would have happened had I not had that. Overall I would definately stay at this hotel again as would the rest of my extended family. You definately cannot beat the price and the great location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: LaurenWestHills
Reviews.Content: What a great place. I have been to San Diego before but I have never stayed at this hotel. I was so pleasantly surprised! The location is perfect. The views of the Harbor are beautiful. I was in town for business but I would love to bring my family next time. The rooms were big and the people at the hotel were extra helpful. I thank them for making my time away from home comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: BWJackson
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego to visit family. i have been to San Diego several times and have stayed at other hotels. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and service that the hotel provided. The prices were well within my budget and the location was very convenient for sightseeing. The view from our room was great. It is obvious that the hotel has recently been renovated. The results are impressive. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Updated Hotel, Spacious Room, Incredible View..... Pretty Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Frangutzo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels at five times the price but truly found this hotel to offer an exceptional value. We expected a small room and just ok views, but the room was spacious, (seemed larger than normal rooms) and the view was INCREDIBLE. The business center, high speed broadband service, workout room, breakfast every morning, microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker made it easy to stay there the week. The hotel was recently updated and the balconies with the harbor view of the yachts coming and going was just awesome. We had a great time and enjoyed the stay. Staff was courteous and seemed "on it".

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelfan0558
Reviews.Content: The room was clean & spacious with a balcony view of the harbor. It was beautiful day & night. The staff was exceedingly polite & gracious to all. We enjoyed the stay & cannot wait to return. The location was close to all the sites we were there for: harbor, Sea World, the boardwalk, shopping with easy access, good food within walking distance, close to the airport, without the noise!! Yes, its a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MarshallGulch
Reviews.Content: We chose this Best Western because of the proximity to events. But I would not go back. First it is VERY dated. The walls and Windows do not keep out the sounds. Very small room. Had to move a chair to get in and out of the door. The bed was comfortable, that was a saving grace. To get your luggage to your room is a ordeal. One cart, no elevator from parking. The staff was very nice, decent cont. breakfast and the downstairs coffee was ok. If you plan to go deep sea fishing at from the landing. This is good. But next time, I would go Next door to the Holiday Inn Bayside. I went next door to check it out. They have a small store downstairs for water, beer, alcohol and small gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: Was unsure of the hotel based on some of the reviews, but we are glad we stayed there. We stayed there before and after our cruise. The front office staff was really helpful even printing off maps and directions from the computer for us on places we wanted to go while there. Our rooms had refrigerator, Microwave, iron and ironing board, coffee maker and coffee, and free wireless internet. The rooms were clean and well kept and we had no complaints. The pool and the hot tube were available and used by us, even though the weather was a little cool. Also used the laundry room and the machines were is excellent working order. They did not have a regular driver for the van, but one of the front office staff droped us off at the Cruise ship terminal and when we returned and called for the van, they did not have a driver, but they did reimburse us for the cab fare from the terminal to the hotel, and for a taxi from the hotel to the airport, which I thought was very unusual, but a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MoosemamaSFBayArea
Reviews.Content: Not the worst place in town but certainly not the best! Maybe they will work out the kinks once they finish remodeling, but it was an irritating place to stay after a long flight. Despite having their van parked prominently out in front, they had to call taxi's for us, as apparently they didn't have anyone to drive the vehicle! They DID reimburse us, but we were still out the tip to the taxi driver. We booked two queen beds and got ONE king size. When we called down, it took a while for them to come with a new key. A maintenance guy brought it, and didn't ask for our old keys until I volunteered...It is scary to stay in a place that doesn't have good security on keys. My brother got a smoking room despite asking for non-smoking. The air conditioner unit in the ceiling dripped water on us every time we walked by--and since it was in the hallway, we got wet a lot. It had a coffeemaker, but not a coffee POT. When I called the front desk, they weren't sure they had another! But they found one--forty minutes later. I tried to call my brother before we got there--no one answered the phone--EVER! I called repeatedly too. On the plus side--it was clean and in a good location. The pool was nice and the staff were pleasant. There are other "bargains" nearby and next time I'd try those first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: daylilly50
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel if you are going to or from the airport or piers. While the room was on the small size it was recently redone, and very attractive, fresh and clean. It had everything you would want, including a microwave, refrigerator, two cordless phones. The shower was great. A plus was the computer room and gym. We had dinner across the street on the harbor at an excellent italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “stayed there practically to use their internet and find another place”
Reviews.Author: fraidelwachy
Reviews.Content: i booked a five night stay at the hotel, and walked in, and went to the rooms. The room was dark, musty, smelly, and extremely small and squishy. we sat on the bed and it was hard like marble. lets just say we're grateful for them having wireless, because i went onto priceline and booked a beautiful hotel for cheaper than this hotel, and it was a 4 star nice big roomy, nicely decorated room with friendly staff and excellent room service.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Yacht Harbor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5005 N Harbor Dr, San Diego, CA 92106
